remarks: Two atoms covering the zero subspace are equal.  ( ~ atcv1 analog.) (Contributed by NM, 10-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lsatcv1.o $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` W ) $.
lsatcv1.p $e |- .(+) = ( LSSum ` W ) $.
lsatcv1.s $e |- S = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lsatcv1.a $e |- A = ( LSAtoms ` W ) $.
lsatcv1.c $e |- C = ( <oL ` W ) $.
lsatcv1.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lsatcv1.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. S ) $.
lsatcv1.q $e |- ( ph -> Q e. A ) $.
lsatcv1.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. A ) $.
lsatcv1.l $e |- ( ph -> U C ( Q .(+) R ) ) $.
lsatcv1 $p |- ( ph -> ( U = { .0. } <-> Q = R ) ) $.
